text: Măng Đen (formerly Đắk Long commune) is a township and capital of Kon Plông District in Kon Tum Province in Vietnam. The township is located 1200 m above sea level on the Mang Den Plateau in the northern parts of the Central Highlands region (in Vietnamese: Tây Nguyên). At 1200 m above sea level, the township has cool climate with average temperatures between 17.0°C to 22.7°C. Mang Den's specific sights are pine forests and wild Himalayan cherry blossom in the winter. It is also known as an area for scientific research in the fields of biotechnology. == References == Category:District capitals in Vietnam Category:Populated places in Kon Tum Province Category:Townships in Vietnam
title: Măng Đen
